newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Foreigners can put $77.6 bln more in Taiwan stocks.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners can put $77.6 bln more in Taiwan stocks.

text.p: Foreign investors can put a further US$77.589 billion into Taiwan's stock market before hitting an official ceiling, the central bank said on Wednesday.
As of June 7, foreign investors are allowed to invest a total of US$88.838 billion in Taiwan stocks, or 25 percent of the market's total value, the bank said in a statement.
Foreign funds had a net outflow of US$64.552 million between June 1-7, with US$113.672 million flowing into Taiwan and US$178.224 million flowing out, the statement said.
In May, foreign funds registered a net outflow of US$436.295 million.
That month the benchmark stock index, beset by political and social jitters, lost more than 300 points in a correction that undercut some of the huge gains of its yearlong bull run.
Taiwan also set a ceiling of US$3 billion for funds raised overseas by local firms through convertible bonds and global depositary receipts.
In that category, foreigners as of June 7 could still pour an additional US$1.214 billion into the island, the central bank said.
